lead_paragraph: In the United States and in France, investors have swooped in and bought big stakes of companies without anyone knowing, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his DealBook column this week. Given the importance of transparency in the markets, he asks, shouldn't something be done about these legal, if aggressive, maneuvers?

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA

headline.main: Big Investors Appear Out of Thin Air

abstract: In the United States and in France, investors have swooped in and bought big stakes of companies without anyone knowing, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his DealBook column this week. Given the importance of transparency in the markets, shouldn't something be done about these legal, if aggressive, maneuvers? he asks
